Identifies whether forward exchange rates are to be interpolated or not. Interpolation occurs when a rate can be established from two known rates. For example, let us say that the one month forward rate for a particular currency is 1.50 and that the three month forward for the same currency is 1.60. Using interpolation, the two-month forward rate will be calculated at 1.55.

The value of this marker is important for the revaluation of Forward contracts using the REBATE revaluation method. Details of the interpolation formula can be found in the Forex Main File documentation. When '2' has been selected in this field, revaluation of forward contracts using the Rebate revaluation method will not interpolate an exchange rate but instead, pick from the FORWARD.RATES table the rate defined on the nearest date compared to the value date of the Foreign Exchange deal. When '1' has been selected, the next available rate will instead be selected.
'Blank' - Rate will be interpolated '1' - Takes the next available rate '2' - Takes the closest rate

This field signifies the revaluation method that must be used for revaluing deals arising out of the application in the APPKIC.ID field. The are only two ways in which revalution is performed, these being :
'SP' - Spot revaluation that uses the spot rate.
'RB' - Rebate revaluation that uses the forward rates table.
Must be either 'SP' or 'RB'
If APPLIC.ID = FX.RB then must be 'RB'
If APPLIC.ID = FX or FX.SP then must be 'SP'
If APPLIC.ID = REST then must be 'SP'
All other applications can be set to either 'SP' or 'RB'

To indicate whether the contracts within spot period must be revalued at different rates for finer revaluation results.
When set to ‘Yes’, the revaluation of contracts maturing TOM and SPOT will happen at different rates , provided the rates for ‘ON’ and ‘TOM’ are defined in FORWARD. RATES table as -1D and -2D.

Provision is also available to calculate Today’s Rate by applying the sum of ON and TOM Premium/Discount to the Mid.Reval.Rate/Reval.Rate. However, population of the same into the field ‘Reval.Rate’ is left to the User’s option which can be done by using a local routine.
When left blank, the revaluation of contract within spot period will be revalued at spot rate i.e. contracts maturing Tomorrow and Spot will be revalued at the same rate.
Validation Rules:
Valid values - ‘YES’ or ‘null’

Specifies the profit and loss category to be used when realising the revaluation profit for a Forex deal between 2 fixed currencies.

When the 2 currencies of a Forex deal are linked to a Fixed currency, i.e. the Euro, there is no longer any fluctuation between the exchange rate as the rate is fixed. Any revaluation unrealised profit and loss can therefore be realised.

If the field REALISE.FIX.PL is set to Y in Forex deals between 2 fixed currencies, the system will post the revaluation profit on the deal to the category specified in this field, reversing the unrealised profit (if booked) from the category defined in the field PROFIT.CATEG. Realisation takes place the night before the fixed rates apply (FIXED.START.DATE in the CURRENCY record), or the next night if the fixed start date has passed.
Accounting Entries:
Cr PRFT.INT.CATEG reval amt Dr PROFT.CATEG reval amt (If Profit posted) Cr PRFT.FIX.CATEG reval amt Dr PRFT.FIX.INT.CT reval amt
Optional Input Must be different to associated PROFIT.CATEG.
A maximum of 5 characters may be entered.
The following values are permitted: CALL VALUE FIRST LAST

To indicate whether the net unrealized revaluation amount must be discounted either from TODAY or SPOT to arrive the present value of the contracts under IFRS framework.
When set to SPOT, the discounting of contracts in forward period will happen from spot date to value date and the contracts within the spot period will not be subjected to discounting.
When set to TODAY, the discounting of contracts will happen from Today to value date, so the contracts either in spot period or forward period will be discounted from Today.
Validation Rules:-
Valid values are ‘TODAY’ or ‘SPOT’
Input allowed only when IFRS.REVALUE is set to ‘Yes’.
If this field is set to 'YES', then the re-valuation profit or loss for Forex and Non Deliverable Forward Deals will be booked in Local currency at deal level.
The deal level unrealized Profit or Loss will be booked at discounted value for Forex Deals under RB Method of Revaluation and for NDF Deals.
For more details, Please refer to User Guide for FOREX Application.
Values allowed are YES, NO and NULL. Will become a No Change field once the record is authorized with a value set to "YES"
A value with NULL is same as value with NO.

This field is used to identify an application for which the fields associated to it are being set up.
Optional input
Must be a valid application set up for the company indicated in the ID or
In the case of Forex it can be set to the following values :
FX.SP - Signifying all Forex contracts that have been set up with a revaluation type of 'SP'
FX.RB - Signifying all Forex contracts that have been set up with a revaluation type of 'RB'
FX.IA - Signifying all Forex contracts that have been set up with a revaluation type of 'IA'
FX - Signifying all forex contract otherwise not defined specifically as above in other words a catch-all set.
Special value of 'ALL' signifies a catch all for the entire system that will be revalued on an individual contract basis.
Special value of 'REST' signifying a catch all which will not be revalued individually but rather in a consolidated manner. In other words this also refers to the forward asset & liability parameters
